intro: Matricaria tzvelevii, commonly known as the Crimean chamomile, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Crimea. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and serrated, dark green leaves. Its flowers bloom in late summer, producing a delicate yellow-white color that resembles true chamomile. This species is valued for its aromatic properties and has been traditionally used in herbal medicine.
